title: add  photo downloadable for chat
body: add  photo downloadable for chat

title: Add a WebPage media type
body:
This doesn't yet expose anything besides the fact that such media type exists.

One potentially problematic API detail is the fact that Webpage cannot be made into an `InputMedia`, so the `copy_media` will silently ignore to attach such media type.

title: Fix panic on IO errors in connect_sender
body: Replaces `Cannot obtain new sender to datacenter authorization error: request error` panic with error propagation

title: Added user and chat photos support
fix(message_box): do not run gap resolve if qts=0
RPC 500 error handling
body: RPC 500 error handling #150

title: add `is_admin` helper method to tl::types::Channel
body: add a method to check if the `current user` is the owner of channel or has admin rights

title: add From<Uploaded> impl for InputFile enum under unstable_raw

add a getter for status in User
[unstable_raw] make unstable_raw API more consistent
body:
- Remove `as_raw` functions from Chat, Group and User
- Add `From<>` implementations from Chat, Group and User to corresponding raw types

title: Add ability to convert Media enum into raw MessageMedia enum
body: Added `From<Media>` implementation for `tl::enums::MessageMedia` under `unstable_raw` feature

title: Add some missing media types
body:
I have added some unimplemented media types and added some getters for them.

Please let me know if you want them to be implemented in a different way

title: Add some getters and unstable_raw feature
body:
- `as_raw` for Group, Channel and User under "unstable_raw"
- `is_animated` and `is_spoiler` for Document media type
- `is_spoiler` for Photo media type
- `access_hash` and `file_reference` for Photo and Document media types under "unstable_raw"

title: Add missing phone number getter on User objects
body: There are very similar getters for `last_name` and `username`, and technically a phone number is the same kind of data: a string. This implements a getter for that string.

title: Fix up clippy lints
body:
Here be 17 commits that manually fix a bunch of lints highlighted by Cargo's Clippy.

None should alter the code's behavior and should amount to make the code a bit cleaner.

title: Include document with thumb in InputMessage
body: When I upload a video, the thumb is missing. please add the method so that we can upload video with thumb.

title: add offset options to requests
body:
+ typo fix
+ offset id option

Add more filters to search messages
Add description for the downloader sample
Added attribute getters
body:
Dear Sir/Madam

I am submitting this pull request to You, with the intent to improve this library, by adding helpful functions to more easily obtain useful information from physically grouped list of variables under one name in a block of memory (also known as "structs"). In my humble opinion, this change can significantly improve developer experience ("DX") for many users of Your library. Therefore I hereby ask for quick merge. Thank you.

Best regards, 
Sincerely,
Yours truly, 

@Marekkon5

title: Remove FLOOD_WAIT logic from file download
body: Since https://github.com/Lonami/grammers/commit/0fd12fab930a74bc5462dc3268ed76460bd07d29 FLOOD_WAIT is handled in the invocation at ```net.rs```

title: Fix extension for files with unknown mime-type
Fix 'API is returning peers without access_hash' assertion error
body: Error happens when executing  ```cargo run --example dialogs``` or  ```cargo run --example downloader -- CHAT``` due to a users with ```min: true``` being returned

title: Fixes download of files
body:
Currently all photo downloads fail with:

```
'Error downloading message: Custom { kind: Other, error: Rpc(RpcError { code: 303, name: 
"FILE_MIGRATE", value: Some(1), caused_by: Some(3193124286) }) }', lib/grammers-client/examples/downloader.rs:128:18
```

This PR fixes it by specifying the largest image size available when downloading. A further possible improvement (not contained in this PR) is to allow the user to specify the size

title: Implement FILE_MIGRATE handling
body:
This PR implements handling of ```FILE_MIGRATE``` errors when trying to download a file that lives in a different datacenter:

  * Maintains a ```HashMap<i32, FileDownloader>``` at client level
  * Detects the error, picks the ```Sender``` from the session datacenter, exports the auth and imports into a new ```Sender``` that will be stored in the ```HashMap```
  * Redo the request
  
  
  ~~WIP: Depends on https://github.com/Lonami/grammers/pull/146~~

title: Implement `Channel::username()`
body: With this, you can use `channel.username()` to get a megagroup/channel username.

body: Partial fix to #133

title: Make `PasswordToken::hint` return `Option<&str>`
body: Fix to https://github.com/Lonami/grammers/issues/131.

title: fix: cannot use grammers as dependency
body:
While `cargo build --all` inside the `grammers` repository itself works without issues, trying to use `grammers-client` as dependency in an external application results in failure:

```bash
$ cargo build
---- SNIP ----
error[E0425]: cannot find function `spawn` in module `tokio::task`
   --> /home/dev/.cargo/git/checkouts/grammers-689e30b82f69dcd5/ba5341c/lib/grammers-client/src/client/files.rs:228:37
    |
228 |             let task = tokio::task::spawn(async move {
    |                                     ^^^^^ not found in `tokio::task`
    |
help: consider importing this function
    |
9   | use std::thread::spawn;
    |
help: if you import `spawn`, refer to it directly
    |
228 -             let task = tokio::task::spawn(async move {
228 +             let task = spawn(async move {
    |

For more information about this error, try `rustc --explain E0425`.
error: could not compile `grammers-client` due to previous error
```

(this is from a fresh `cargo init` project except with `grammers-client` specified as dependency)

This issue is preventing `grammers` to be used at all.

After investigation, it turns out to be a `tokio` feature resolution issue. When building inside the repo, the `rt` feature of `tokio` is enabled since it's specified in the `[dev-dependencies]` section. However, when used a library outside of the repo, the `[dev-dependencies]` section is ignored and the `tokio` crate is resolved without the `rt` feature enabled, causing the build failure.

This PR fixes the issue, simply by enabling `rt` in the `[dependencies]` section as well.

title: connect_with_proxy

#126  

Add proxy field to InitParms. Connect server with proxy if set.
